name: AutoDocSite
install_msg:
Thank you for installing the AutoDocSite cog!

This cog automatically generates a documentation site for your bot's cogs using GitHub Pages and MkDocs.  If you want to help translate, go to my [crowdin](<https://crowdin.com/project/Star-Cogs>)
If you like my work, [donate me!](<https://ko-fi.com/starcogs>)

```txt
Below are the steps to set it up:

1. **Set Repository Directory**
   - Use the command `[p]setsite repo_dir <path>` to set the directory where your documentation repository is located on your host server. This is where the generated documentation files will be stored.

2. **Configure GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT)**
   - Go to your GitHub account settings, navigate to Developer settings > Personal Access Tokens > Tokens (Classic), and generate a new token.
   - Ensure the token has full access to the 'Repo' scope, which is necessary for pushing changes to your GitHub repository.

3. **Install MkDocs and Theme**
   - Ensure MkDocs and the desired theme (e.g., `mkdocs-dracula-theme`) are installed on your server. You can install them using pip:
     ```
     pip install mkdocs mkdocs-dracula-theme
     ```

4. **Set Site Configuration**
   - Use the various `[p]setsite` commands to configure your documentation site settings, such as `site_name`, `custom_domain`, `theme_name`, etc.

5. **Build and Deploy Documentation**
   - Once all settings are configured, navigate to your local repository directory and run the following commands to build and deploy your site:
     ```
     mkdocs build
     mkdocs gh-deploy
     ```
   - When prompted for your GitHub username and password, use your username and the generated PAT as the password.

6. **Verify Deployment**
   - After deployment, your documentation site should be live on GitHub Pages. Check your GitHub repository's settings to ensure the Pages feature is enabled.

7. **Enjoy Easy Documentation Generation!**
   - With everything set up, you can now generate and update your documentation site effortlessly.

For help with commands, use `[p]help AutoDocSite`. If you'd like to contribute translations, visit our [Crowdin project](https://crowdin.com/project/Star-Cogs).

Happy documenting!```
description: Automatic generation of documentation using GH-Pages and MkDocs.
